>
[Half Plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=49)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 273 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 18 gp

**AC Bonus** +5

**Dex Cap** +1

**Check Penalty** -3

**Speed Penalty** -10 ft.
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** +3

**Bulk** 3

**Category** Heavy

**Group** Plate
</row>

</column>

---

Half plate consists of most of the upper body plates used in [full plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=13), with lighter or sparser steel plate protection for the arms and legs. This provides some of the protection of full plate with greater flexibility and speed. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of [padded armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=3) and a pair of [gauntlets](/Weapons.aspx?ID=4).

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-4" />
